0: A Gold Coast man is dead after he was shot in the chest during the filming of a music video for Australian band Bliss n Eso in the Brisbane CBD. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police were called to Eagle Lane about 2pm after reports shots were fired inside Brooklyn Standard, a basement bar. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Stuntman Johann Ofner, 28, was on set for the filming of Bliss n Eso's music video when he was fatally injured. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The film crew performed CPR on the man before emergency services arrived, Detective Inspector Tom Armitt told media outside the venue. Photo: Facebook NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Several firearms were discharged during a scene by several actors," he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "As result of the use of those firearms, one actor has received wounds to the chest and has subsequently died of those injuries. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Advertisement NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "A number of firearms were being used during the scene, I can't tell you whether they were live or real firearms, the type of ammunition being used, that will be subject to the investigation. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "No other persons who were present were injured." Photo: Jorge Branco NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A statement from Mushroom Group, Bliss n Eso's management, confirmed the band was not on site at the time of the incident. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police said the incident was believed to be accidental but was being treated as suspicious until proven otherwise. Photo: Twitter NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Nearby office worker Carlo described the panic in the immediate aftermath of the shooting. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "We just saw all the police running in there and people from the film crew running out. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "And then pretty much just watched it unfold and all the ambos and all that ran in there and then after that, about 20 minutes later, they all came out with all their machinery, defibs and all that. No one came out, no stretcher or anything." Photo: Lidia Nikonova NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Brooklyn Standard management released a statement via its Facebook page, informing patrons it would remain closed on Monday night while police continued to investigate. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "The incident occurred during a film shoot at the venue, for which Brooklyn Standard had been wholly rented out, outside of opening hours," it said. Photo: Carlo NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "We would like everyone to know that none of our staff were involved in the incident and everyone is safe, and we are doing everything we can to help the police investigation at this time. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Our thoughts and prayers are with the family and friends of the individual involved, and we appreciate your respect and understanding at this time."
